news.title: ‘I was petrified one of us would be used in a sacrifice’ – Gena Heraty speaks out for first time since release by Haiti kidnappers
news.summary: Mayo woman Gena Heraty has told for the first time of her horrific ordeal in which she was kidnapped and held captive for 27 days in Haiti.

news.title: ‘I had to dig pretty deep to show up today, but I'm here’ – Simon Harris refuses to speculate on political future following threats to family
news.summary: Tánaiste Simon Harris has refused to speculate on his political future following several recent threats against his family, saying he had to "dig pretty deep" to show up to today’s Fine Gael think-in.

news.title: Brother of presidential hopeful Billy Kelleher seeking deal over debts of €4.7m, including €350,000 owed to taxman
news.summary: A brother of Fianna Fáil presidential election hopeful Billy Kelleher has been given temporary protection from creditors after running up debts of €4.7m, including €350,000 owed to the taxman.

news.title: Stalking accused (23) followed influencer into lift, held his belt and stared at her, court told
news.summary: A south Dublin man accused of stalking a social media influencer followed the woman from a city street into a hotel lift, held his belt and “stared” at her, it is alleged.

news.title: Woman (60s) killed following crash involving motorcycle and truck in Kildare
news.summary: A female motocyclist has died following a collision with a truck near Kilcock, Co Kildare.

news.title: Dónal Lynch: Leo’s snog showed some of us are more equal than others
news.summary: I sometimes think of Leo Varadkar as the Forrest Gump of the gay rights movement in Ireland. He waited until it was safe politically to come out and was against gay adoption before that. Within a few short years he was on the cover of  Time magazine as Ireland’s first gay taoiseach.

news.title: ‘It’s been an incredible 45 years’ – Irish folk singer Mary Back is retiring as she announces farewell shows
news.summary: Mary Black has announced she will soon be retiring from live music.

news.title: Colin Murphy: For better or worse, here’s what could happen if our next president goes rogue
news.summary: We describe our presidency as a ­“ceremonial” one. But that is based on a combination of constitutional constraints and convention. What if those conventions changed? What if an activist president, or an ­external crisis, challenged those limits and pushed the presidency into new ground?

news.title: Manchester City and Premier League reach settlement over APT rules
news.summary: Manchester City and the Premier League have reached a settlement in their dispute over the rules governing associated party transactions (APTs).

news.title: ‘I’d rather two extra teachers than hot meals’ – primary-school principal says current class sizes ‘not sustainable’
news.summary: A primary-school principal in Kildare is calling on the Government to decrease pupil-teacher ratios – or risk harming education standards.
